events.title: Fall of Masada
events.description: The Roman Empire captures the fortress of Masada in present-day Israel after a lengthy siege, marking the end of the First Jewishâ€“Roman War.
events.significance: This event symbolizes Jewish resistance and has become a significant cultural and historical symbol in Jewish history.

events.title: Battle of Culloden
events.description: The Battle of Culloden takes place in Scotland, where British government forces defeat the Jacobite uprising led by Charles Edward Stuart (Bonnie Prince Charlie).
events.significance: This battle effectively ends the Jacobite rising of 1745 and leads to the consolidation of British control over Scotland.

events.title: Titanic Sets Sail
events.description: The RMS Titanic departs Southampton, England, on its maiden voyage towards New York City.
events.significance: The Titanic would famously sink on April 15, 1912, after hitting an iceberg, becoming one of the deadliest peacetime maritime disasters.

events.title: Sicilian Mafia Arrests
events.description: In a major crackdown, the Italian police arrest key members of the Sicilian Mafia, signaling aggressive attempts to weaken organized crime during World War II.
events.significance: This marked an important development in combating organized crime in Italy during a tumultuous period.

events.title: Virginia Tech Shooting
events.description: One of the deadliest school shootings in U.S. history occurs at Virginia Tech University, where a gunman kills 32 people before taking his own life.
events.significance: The tragedy sparked nationwide debates about gun control, campus safety, and mental health awareness.
